EAScenario.name: Tracking App
EAScenario.description:
Value proposition: Allows tracking and notification (in emergency cases) of unusual movements among elderly. Can be used by elderly themselves or their next of kin or formal care givers. The scenario will demonstrate how a simple application is developed and downloaded by an elderly, and how gradually as the elderly becomes more frail family members and service providers get involved. Basic functionality:
  • Indoor and outdoor tracking of users, both location, fall, abnormal accelerations (e.g. falls)
  • Plotting location on map
  • Allowing others (family, home care) to view location
  • Allow notification to others in specific cases (e.g. out of predefined area, falls)
Pros:
  • Simple application known to everybody. The application does not have any novelty at all so the scenario work can focus on platform issues.
  • Important and considerably challenging topic within AAL. Falls and dementia are interesting cases.
  • Can demonstrate the commercial value of uAAL. Location and acceleration sensors are now common-place in most mobile phones. Services are also partly available. Showing how uAAL platform supports developing such a service can be interesting for potential companies wanting to enter our community.
Cons:
  • Innovation level low.
  • No fancy device integration, only a couple of sensors.
